text: mapslices is one of the most complicated array functions, I don't envy you!

elements.text: mapslices is one of the most complicated array functions, I don't envy you!

text:
It’s super weird once you look at it closely.
Because it wants to reconstruct an array of the same demensions.

E.g. in the matrix case:
If your return a vector from the function you get the slice replaces with that vector (even if it is a different length),.
if you return any other type of abstract array, you get an error
if you return anything else then you get that slice dimension replaces to have size 1, and that value in that position.

for the >2D case it is vaguely more complex still.


`map` + `eachslice` is much simpler, since it just always gives back a vector of the results.
